article.title: One of the Gang
article.text:
When fire tore through the Hole in the Wall Gang Camp in Ashford last week, Fox61 anchor Ben Goldman tweeted, “As a former camper, to watch & report on a place that is so special to me and many others…was heartbreaking.”
Ben, who grew up in Wethersfield, was diagnosed with brain cancer at age 8. He went through two years of extensive chemotherapy. While he still has the brain tumor, which is inoperable, the cancer is gone.
He remains very connected to Paul Newman’s Hole in the Wall camp. As he says, “The building can be replaced, but the arts and crafts made by children who have now passed away…are irreplaceable.”

The post One of the Gang appeared first on The Laurel | "Fostering cooperation among legislative newspapermen (and women, and broadcast journalists, and bloggers, and media junkies).".
